intro: Centaurea calliacantha, commonly known as the Sicilian star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny, bristly foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Centaurea calliacantha is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
